title: League of Pathfinders: Playable Races
body:
Wasn't entirely sure where to post this, but I feel as though this place would provide me with the best answers.

I'm working on building a Runeterra setting in Pathfinder and am currently working on races. Humans, trolls, Shadow Isles undead, voidborn, and yordles are all presently set up as playable races. I have ideas for darkin and vastaya but need more information before I go any further with them.

With that in mind, can anybody else think of any other races from Runeterra that would be suitable as a playable race?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-04-07T20:17:18.673+0000)
>
> What about Alistar's people?  

If his current lore still canon, i would say that they are in a cemetery right now.

> [{quoted}](name=Ebonmaw Dragon,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2017-04-07T20:41:36.131+0000)
>
> If his current lore still canon, i would say that they are in a cemetery right now.

http://i.imgur.com/lLrDkWu.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2017-04-07T20:58:42.829+0000)
>
> http://i.imgur.com/lLrDkWu.jpg

Well... the drawing could have been made before the genocide of the Minotaurs, but i guess that it's better to think that the minotaurs aren't extinct.

... However, Im more concerned about the existance of the Weird Fish with human face now.

> [{quoted}](name=Ebonmaw Dragon,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=0003000100000000,timestamp=2017-04-07T21:20:28.594+0000)
>
> Well... the drawing could have been made before the genocide of the Minotaurs, but i guess that it's better to think that the minotaurs aren't extinct.
> 
> ... However, Im more concerned about the existance of the Weird Fish with human face now.

That is a very valid concern.  What's their fishy agenda?  Can we trust them?

{{champion:267}}  "People and their air..."

Simply to remove air, who needs it anyway....

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=00030001000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-07T21:51:48.089+0000)
>
> That is a very valid concern.  What's their fishy agenda?  Can we trust them?

I'm pretty sure that //they// can't trust //us//. Right there above the poor fish-bodied Braum it appears to say "Boiled Bolbo head soup", which is scratched out and revised with "Dried Bolbo".

Are they the Bolbo?! Are we eating them?!?

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2017-04-07T20:58:42.829+0000)
>
> http://i.imgur.com/lLrDkWu.jpg

What What What?? Where does this little gem hail from? Bio it's good to see you but you're giving me a heart attack.

> [{quoted}](name=MythicTwister,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=0003000100000001,timestamp=2017-04-07T23:22:14.423+0000)
>
> What What What?? Where does this little gem hail from? Bio it's good to see you but you're giving me a heart attack.

From the [Medarda Heirloom](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/piltover/medarda-heirloom) map that was released as part of the Piltover update.  Sorry if you didn't catch that one when it came out :(

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=00030001000000010000,timestamp=2017-04-07T23:32:41.918+0000)
>
> From the [Medarda Heirloom](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/piltover/medarda-heirloom) map that was released as part of the Piltover update.  Sorry if you didn't catch that one when it came out :(

Holy Demacia! Thank you for the link! Time to pour through it and wonder what other wonders I have missed!

Wow. Wasn't expecting a Rioter response. I appreciate you taking the time.

I thought the minotaur and ursine were going to be revealed to be vastaya, but if they're more a phylum as I've heard, they're definitely viable. And I forgot about the marai as well though you are correct about their exclusivity. I though Skarner was currently the last Brackern? Though if I did construct them as a race, it would probably be the most mechanically interesting race I've done just because of how different they are.

You nearly doubled my current races - you helped plenty. Thank you for that!

> [{quoted}](name=THE BIG BROTHER,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=00030004,timestamp=2017-04-07T23:50:40.573+0000)
>
> Wow. Wasn't expecting a Rioter response. I appreciate you taking the time.
> 
> I thought the minotaur and ursine were going to be revealed to be vastaya, but if they're more a phylum as I've heard, they're definitely viable. And I forgot about the marai as well though you are correct about their exclusivity. I though Skarner was currently the last Brackern? Though if I did construct them as a race, it would probably be the most mechanically interesting race I've done just because of how different they are.
> 
> You nearly doubled my current races - you helped plenty. Thank you for that!

As of Skarner's [current lore](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/shurima/skarner), he's not the last of his species as much as he is the only one awake.  I'm sure your players might enjoy playing a brackern who was dug up by explorers and taken away, etc.  

Even if he weren't, I'm pretty sure RPG players can find innovative ways to play the second-to-last member of a species no matter the situation ;)
Huh. I missed that bit. Well, I'll have to look into constructing the brackern as a race then!

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-04-07T20:17:18.673+0000)
>
> What about Alistar's people?  Also, there's the Ursine (Volibear's people).  Marai?  (Nami's people - though it'd be much more appropriate for an underwater campaign).  Props to AndreiRayanovsky for remembering the Brackern, too!  
> 
> There may be more - just trying to help :D
> 
> {{champion:12}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:72}}

its been my dream to play a bear in pathfinder




may it come true

I have made a bear for Pathfinder. Enjoy.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/p001dcO6-league-of-pathfinders-core-races
So shall it be.
What about {{champion:105}} 's people?
I'm not even sure what they're called but that's another good suggestion.
For all we know, they disappeared forever. Who knows what happened?
I'd think alistar was vastayan too! right?

Gonna say now, Darkin are a no go. Only 5 exist so its not possible to have 500 RP as them.
Other races would be 
Demons (Noc, Tahm)
Shapeshifters (Nid, ancient Vastayans.)
Hextech augmented punks
Brackern
Targonians (VERY lesser deities) 
Wildcards (Shaco, Fiddle, Malph)

The way the guy talked about the Darkin in the Vastaya story made it seem like there were more than five Darkin, but they may have simply been my reading comprehension.

I know Tahm's a demon, but was it confirmed that Nocturne was? And I'd honestly prefer to leave demons as demons unless we learn they're an exceedingly common race.

Shapeshifters are an interesting idea. I'll have to look into that.

Augmentation is more likely to be derived from class rather than race, but that is an idea I'll consider.

I thought Skarner was currently the only survivor of the race? Did I miss out on some new piece of lore or something? If so, they'd be a very mechanically unusual race.

Same for demons, I'm kinda reluctant to include deities as a playable race.

And many of the wild cards are so much that - so unique - that making a race would be impractical because they're the only known creatures like that. If a player really wanted to play as one of them, I'd be all for it, but it's a race that I or they would construct on the spot.

Except Malphite. Who is a living mountain.

Thanks for all the ideas!

Well didn't know if you are making it in our time, or say During the Rune Wars. Demons appear to be mildly common, though majority of them are just little servants to wtiches (Hinted at with new Demacia lore) 

Ye only 5 Darkin, its on AAtrox page. 

And these are merely random ideas I think of xD Like wildcards could be for if someone makes their own completely badass awesome lore and you wanna make it work.

I was going for a modern setting so that I could use the champions as NPC's. I'm using the Pathfinder system and while I'm down to create new demons, I'm reluctant to make them a playable race.

I'm totally down for if someone wants to make their character though I would like to see it use the lore of the world. Otherwise, what's the point of the setting?

You might want to make a creature/creation race. Let players build a monster like Warwick or magitech experiment like Zac.

Also, in advance races or pathfinder srd website, you can find rules for creating new races. If your pathfinder players play LoL, just set a point cap and let them custom create thier stats/race as well.

I've got the Advanced Race Guide. I do like that idea. If characters really wanted to build their own races based off of singular iterations of characters, I'd be all for it. I'm just trying to get a good baseline for people to build off of.

Ah a fellow Pathfinder. I am so overjoyed. My respect to you, for sticking to the only last remaining, true, Dungeons and Dragons edition :D

 {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 

IMO, try to find that technology guide if you want to implement those "experiment" races. There are some guidelines about the artificial limb implants, etc. Also, next to that, you can create a whole new race, using "Advanced Race Guide".
However, i wouldn't go with making every race playable, if i were you. I mean, you have a typical hero-type characters in LoL ({{champion:18}} , {{champion:51}} , {{champion:21}} , {{champion:86}} , {{champion:99}}, etc.) and then you got a characters like {{champion:6}} , {{champion:31}}, {{champion:19}} and i dont know which, that fits more into NPC\Boss type (Cho as a boss.. man, id like to see that :D )

But what for classes? Id imagine that Gunslingers, Witches and Duelists will be a lot prominent here :D . Also, id like to see a build for a character that is a kin to LeBlanc, for instance (well, i might have something on my mind already :D)

It feels as though we are so few.

I have both those books, and I've actually already developed some races (https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/p001dcO6-league-of-pathfinders-core-races).

I definitely agree with you there. There are some races/character types in League that would not fit as playable races. I actually was looking at Aurelion Sol and Kindred as deities with domains and subdomains and such.

I'd figure most classes are open to players for their characters. And I actually made LeBlanc (using the original rules) as an illusionist wizard, looking at branching into the veiled illusionist prestige class.

Thanks for the input!

Personally I'd have put it under miscellaneous just so the mods couldn't delete it. 
As for other races, 'elder entities' as a blanket for the indeterminately ancient or unique only-of it's-kind champions (such as aatrox, nocturne, tahmkench, ext).
Dungeons & dragons also has a huge variety of inspirational subjects in the fringes, since the main books are pretty same-y about the classical fantasy races.

Most elder entities would be too powerful to function as a playable race. They could certainly be toned down, as they are in the actual game, but that would be a case-by-case basis.

Yeah, I'm using the Pathfinder Advanced Race Guide to build the races. Trying to stick with what League has to offer though.

Appreciate the suggestions!

I didn't mean literally using other elder entities like cthulu or anything; it was just the first category I could think of to throw all the strangely powerful loner champions into. Probably use some template &/or monster as a basis, and tweak it individually for each.

You're welcome, it's a nice change of pace seeing stuff like this in the forums!

Honestly, they'll probably end up as potential adversaries in the setting. I'd like to make it so that you could literally make every champion as a playable character but if I want to be true to the lore, there are definitely ones that are simply too powerful to do so with. Now, I could still design them as a monstrous race reserved for high level play . . . Hmm. You've given me some things to consider.

Glad to be of service, but, uh . . . change of pace from what?

Oh yeah lore has to be restrained when changing settings & playstyles between games. 
There's plenty of variety for that creativity too; harsh drawbacks to strong powers, or perhaps good average ability while facing even more devastating enemies, ext. Glad I could help :D

The usual stuff here in the forums. Anything from posts begging riot about A or B, debating whether a change was good or bad, elaborating & creating more lore/artwork, ext. Rarely see any discussions about topics referring to things outside of league or life, so I like to at least read them.

There's that or I could try scaling some of the stronger beings down. It's something I'll look into.

Oh. Yeah, I see what you're talking about. It's kinda that I enjoy League, but RPG's (Pathfinder, Gamma World, Palladium, etc.) are my true loves. So, mixing the two together would be a dream come true for me.
That's definitely a good start. I've only played a little pathfinder but I'm unfamiliar with the other two; which is why I referenced d&d lol. Good luck & have fun dude!
Appreciate it! And likewise.

{{champion:16}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:10}} Celestials with diminished powers would likely fit. Give them storyline stuff as well (attempting to redeem themselves or whatnot).
{{champion:63}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:54}} {{champion:40}} show that perhaps creating an elemental template might be interesting for player character options.

Diminished celestials could work. I'll have to look into that.

Well, Malphite's the size of a mountain and Anivia is a bird so she might not function well in a RPG setting, but elementals in general as a PC race is something I'll definitely consider.

Imo, many of the factions are so distinct that they could substitute "races" in games such as pathfinder. Noxus and Bilgewater are eclectic collections of many different peoples; they'd be two groups of  non-specific "human" races in pathfinder. Demacia is pretty much a non-magical "warrior race". Freljordians are the only people with Iceborn blood. Ionians mirror much of what you'd expect of elves in dnd/pathfinder. Piltover/Zaun has a lot of unique stuff going on unique to Runeterra. Shurimans are hardy nomads. Etc, etc. I'd play with that rather than the usual idea of races.
So you are saying that {{champion:157}} is an elf? Seems fitting :P

I was entertaining the idea of doing an Iceborn race.

See, I was going to portray that by having the option of alternate racial traits - people switching out certain racial features (like the skilled trait or bonus feat trait that humans have) for others. This allows people to play humans from distinct regions while still having the baseline human.

Appreciate the idea though.

Interesting idea. Do you have any ideas for how you're going to incorporate marksmen? Generally, ranged characters in Pathfinder are actually the least effective at slaying durable targets (because they rely on multiple small hits of damage and damage reduction applies to each individual shot).

Critical multipliers are higher on some ranged weapons (bows have x3, most guns have x4), but there's no way to itemize critical strike chance like there is in League.

> [{quoted}](name=The Yetii Rider,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-04-08T03:44:21.739+0000)
>
> Interesting idea. Do you have any ideas for how you're going to incorporate marksmen? Generally, ranged characters in Pathfinder are actually the least effective at slaying durable targets (because they rely on multiple small hits of damage and damage reduction applies to each individual shot).
> 
> Critical multipliers are higher on some ranged weapons (bows have x3, most guns have x4), but there's no way to itemize critical strike chance like there is in League.

Must cerntianly there is, its called keen. lowers what you have to role on the d20 to crit. magical effects do it, some weapons have lower bases (like 19 or 18) and feats and classes can increase your crit range as well.

I've been making League characters as Pathfinder characters for a bit and usually the best option I've found for Marksmen is either ranger, rogue, or gunslinger (with some exceptions). The favored enemy class of the ranger helps with consistent damage whereas gunslingers are pretty much the only class that gets a firearm starting out. The gunslinger's are helped by their ability to add their Dexterity to their damage with firearms.

As noted by the Cowley, the keen weapon special ability increases the critical chance of weapons. Similarly, the feat Improved Critical does so for a specific type of weapon. Now, most of these abilities don't stack. However, in honor of how League of Legends works and depending on the game, I could see maybe allowing one or two such effects to stack.

OP, you should do, like, a group of experiments A.K.A characters that have modified bodies with whatever. Ingame examples'd be: {{champion:36}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:27}} {{champion:29}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:112}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:154}}

It'd be a neat idea, but several of those (Dr. Mundo, Singed, Viktor, Warwick) are better reflected by taking suitable classes than making a new race. In the case of the others, they have rather singular existences. If a player wanted to play such a character, I would happily work with them to develop that race, but it isn't common enough to warrant a common race.

Appreciate the input!

I would advice you to look into the universe section of the lol site, there are a lot of information about lore and stuff, also the lol wikia. 

By the way I do not recommend adding the vastaya as a playable race yet because we don't have many information about them. 

The darkin race I feel is difficult as well because we don't have many information yet.

Yeah, I'm digging through that as well. I was just hoping I could find some people to help me save some time.

That's what I'm thinking for both of them. I do have rough ideas for them, but I'm refraining from putting anything concrete down until I have a beter idea about them. And depending on which old lore is still canon, there may still only be five darkin, in which case I wouldn't bother making them a playable race.

Thanks for the suggestions!

> [{quoted}](name=THE BIG BROTHER,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Iugr9MVK,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-04-07T08:41:12.621+0000)
>
> Yeah, I'm digging through that as well. I was just hoping I could find some people to help me save some time.
> 
> That's what I'm thinking for both of them. I do have rough ideas for them, but I'm refraining from putting anything concrete down until I have a beter idea about them. And depending on which old lore is still canon, there may still only be five darkin, in which case I wouldn't bother making them a playable race.
> 
> Thanks for the suggestions!

Darkin shouldn't be a playable race since htey're rare to the point of 5 of them being around. If anything, see if you can get the story to revolve around the Darkin or possibly have  one or two appear in the story to battle.

Just remember that Darkin are the weapons.  Aatrox is The Darkin Blade.  As in the sword is aatrox.   The body is a host the parasite attached to.  We could Theorize that Varus's bow might be a Darkin as well.  If that's the case, then you can use him as an example of what happens if one of your players uses a Darkin weapon.

Your primary goal is to gather the races that have legit playable males/females that would be able to equip most of the armor sets and to be easy for their combat animations, for example if you take Volidbear's race you can't even tell who are the males or females so its not worth it, while Vastaya, Yordles etc you can easily make them playable
